page.title: 18TOURISM
page.content: INTERESTS TO VISITORS IN THE AREA The availability of former agricultural cottages as weekend cottages has increased the visitors to the area.Also, some farmers let cottages to holidaymakers.A few homes offer bed and breakfast,including the post office.There are some Caravan Club listed sites in the area, including some which accomodate meets for caravanning groups. The area is designated as one of Outstanding Natural Beauty.It attracts walkers,geologists,birdwatchers and botonists.The lead mining areas provide interest to visitors and the attractive Hope Valley gorge has been a favourite drive out from Shrewsbury since horse drawn days.
